page.title: 19Weymouth Fire Station.
page.content: { Weymouth Fire Station}is situated at the bottom of{Boot Hill.}It has no pole because the Station is on one level. The firemen are split into{four {"watches"-Red,White,Blue and Green. Each Watch consists of about{13 men. The{day shift works}for{9 hours}and the{night shift for 15 hours.}The Chief is the organiser of everything and also attends the more serious fires. Altogether there are about{50 {men in the Station.}There are{5 fire {engines,}two of which are special Engines eg.one with a 100 foot ladder. {4 or 5 men}travel{in each engine.}A {tank}in an Engine carries{1800 litres {of water.}To get into the fire engine, be ready and{to be on their way takes {90 seconds.}When not putting out fires firemen{attend road accidents,help the {RSPCA.,do salvage work and make fire {prevention checks.}-Neil Appleby.
